  • Constructor Details

    • ModifyPlotScreen

      public ModifyPlotScreen​(View v)
      Constructor for ModifyPlotScreen, assigns new instance of Controller to imc. Creates the scene for ModifyPlotScreen.
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • updatePage

      public void updatePage()
      Description copied from class: Screen
      Abstract method used by every screen to update dynamic aspects of the screen.
      Specified by:
      updatePage in class Screen

    • update

      public void update​(java.lang.String type, java.lang.String leps, java.lang.String cost, java.lang.String name)
      Updates the variables for Total Leps, Budget Remaining, Plant Name, Leps Supported, Plant Type, and Plant Cost in ModifyPlotScreen.
      Parameters:
      type - the plant type Herbaceous or Woody
      leps - the number of leps supported by the plant
      cost - the cost of the plant
      name - the name of the plant

    • DragAndDrop

      public void DragAndDrop​(javafx.scene.image.ImageView iv)
      Calls the DragEvent methods setOnDragDetected, setOnDragOver and setOnDragDropped for drag and drop of plants.
      Parameters:
      iv - the ImageView of the plant

    • onGardenDragDetected

      public void onGardenDragDetected​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event, javafx.scene.image.ImageView iv)
      Starts the Drag and Drop Gesture on a plant ImageView by calling the startDragAndDrop method. The transfer mode supported by the gesture source is defined, and the data to be transferred is placed onto the dragboard.
      Parameters:
      event - the MouseEvent for when the plant is clicked on
      iv - the ImageView of the plant

    • onGardenDragOver

      public void onGardenDragOver​(javafx.scene.input.DragEvent event)
      Handles a DRAG_OVER Event on a Target. Specifies which object accepts the data by implementing the DRAG_OVER event handler. Calls the acceptTransferModes() method on the event, passing the COPY_OR_MOVE transfer mode that the target accepts.
      Parameters:
      event - the DragEvent for when the plant is Dragged Over

    • onGardenDragDropped

      public void onGardenDragDropped​(javafx.scene.input.DragEvent event)
      Handles a DRAG_DROPPED Event on a Target. The DRAG_DROPPED event is sent to the gesture target when the mouse button is released on the gesture target. A new Circle object of the plant is created and placed on the garden plot/anchorPane in the exact location where the mouse button was released. Completes the drag and drop gesture by calling the setDropCompleted() method on the event.
      Parameters:
      event - the DragEvent for when the plant is dropped on the gesture target

    • removePlant

      public void removePlant​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event, javafx.scene.shape.Circle iv)
      Removes the plant/circle object from the garden plot/anchorPane.
      Parameters:
      event - the MouseEvent for when the plant/circle object is right clicked
      iv - the circle object of the plant being removed from the garden

    • checkDragDropCollision

      public void checkDragDropCollision​(javafx.scene.shape.Circle iv)
      Checks if there is a collision when a plant is dragged from the plant menu to the garden plot. Detects collision when the dragged plant is dropped/placed on an existing circle plant object in the garden plot/ AnchorPane. If collision is detected, the new circle plant object is placed next to the existing circle plant object.
      Parameters:
      iv - the circle object of the plant

    • checkCollision

      public boolean checkCollision​(javafx.scene.shape.Circle iv)
      Checks if there is a collision between plants when a circle plant object is dragged around the garden plot. Detects collision when the dragged circle plant object touches an existing circle plant object in the garden plot/AnchorPane. If collision is detected, the drag MouseEvent of the dragged circle plant object is stopped until the mouse cursor is moved to an area in the garden plot where collision is not detected.
      Parameters:
      iv - the circle object of the plant

    • setCurrentPlantImage

      public void setCurrentPlantImage​(javafx.scene.image.ImageView iv)
      Setter for currentIV. Takes in the ImageView of a plant and sets it equal to the current ImageView (currentIV).
      Parameters:
      iv - the ImageView of the plant

    • checkbox

      public void checkbox​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​javafx.scene.image.ImageView> imageViews, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Plant> plants)
      Displays plants in the plant selection menu based upon which check boxes are checked and unchecked. If Herbaceous and Woody is selected, all plants are displayed in the plant selection menu. If only Herbaceous is selected, only Herbaceous plants will be displayed in the plant selection menu. If only Woody is selected, only Woody plants will be displayed in the plant selection menu. If neither Herbaceous nor Woody is selected, no plants will be displayed in the plant selection menu.
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent of clicking the check box
      imageViews - the HashMap of current ImageViews in the plant selection menu based on selected conditions
      plants - the HashMap of all plants in the application

    • setScreenOutline

      public void setScreenOutline()
      Declares, Initializes and sets the Nodes/Panes for a BorderPane Outline. Creates CheckBoxes, VBoxes, HBoxes, StackPanes, ScrollPane, AnchorPane and BorderPane. vBoxImages contains the names and ImageViews of all the plants in the plant selection menu. scrollPane contains the vBoxImages to be able to scroll through the selection of plants. vBoxLeftBorder contains the CheckBoxes and ScrollPane. anchorPane is the garden plot which contains all the plants in the garden. hBoxBottom contains the settings, summary, and fauna screen buttons.

    • label

      public void label()
      Initializes and sets the Panes and Labels for the top of the BorderPane Outline. Initializes labels for budget, budget remaining, total leps and adds them to the top right of ModifyPlotScreen. Initializes labels for sun exposure, soil type, moisture level, garden dimensions, plant name, leps supported, plant type, plant cost and adds them to the top left of ModifyPlotScreen. Adds the garden name to the top center of ModifyPlotScreen.

    • settingsButton

      public void settingsButton()
      Creates the settings button and adds it to the bottom center of ModifyPlotScreen.

    • summaryButton

      public void summaryButton()
      Creates the summary button and adds it to the bottom center of ModifyPlotScreen.

    • faunaButton

      public void faunaButton()
      Creates the fauna button and adds it to the bottom center of ModifyPlotScreen.

    • findCommomName

      public java.lang.String findCommomName​(javafx.scene.image.ImageView iv)
      Iterates through the HashMap of current ImageViews in the plant selection menu. Takes in an ImageView and find the corresponding ImageView in the HashMap plantIVs and returns the name of that plant.
      Parameters:
      iv - the ImageView of the plant
      Returns:
      commonname the common name of the plant

      Returns:
      gardenbudget the budget of the garden

    • getWoody

      public void getWoody​(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> wplants)
      Sets the Collection of woody plant names
      Parameters:

    • getHerb

      public void getHerb​(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> hplants)
      Sets the Collection of herbaceous plant names
      Parameters:
      hplants - Collection of herbaceous plant names

    • createImages

      public void createImages​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> imagePNGs, java.lang.String Weather, java.lang.String Soil, java.lang.String Moisture, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Plant> plants)
      Iterates through the HashMap of all plant PNG file names in the application and creates an ImageView for each plant. Displays plant names and ImageViews in the plant selection menu based upon which sun exposure, soil type and moisture level is selected by the user. Only plants that meet all user selected conditions will be displayed in the plant selection menu.
      Parameters:
      imagePNGs - the HashMap of all plant PNG file names in the application
      Weather - the sun exposure of the garden
      Soil - the soil type of the garden
      Moisture - the moisture level of the garden
      plants - the HashMap of all plants in the application

    • scaleGarden

      public void scaleGarden​(java.lang.String dim)
      Sets the scaled plant image height and width based on the user inputed garden dimensions.
      Parameters:
      dim - the user inputed garden dimensions
